feature_name: Fix /hub/beta/ redirect loop in Netlify rules
scope_summary: Remove the /hub/beta -> /hub/beta/ forced redirect that created a self-redirect loop, while keeping the /hub/beta/* SPA rewrite to /hub/beta/index.html.

legal_and_regulatory.rationale: Routing rule correction only; no policy or legal surface changes.

privacy_local_first_promise.rationale: No data flow changes; fix affects URL routing only.
evidence: No storage or network endpoint code changes

medical_scope_and_claims.rationale: No medical language or behavior involved.

user_benefit_and_harm_check.rationale: Users can load /hub/beta/ successfully instead of being trapped in a redirect loop.
evidence: Pre-fix verification showed repeated 301 responses for /hub/beta/
Rule removal keeps SPA fallback behavior through /hub/beta/* rewrite

brand_voice_and_claims.rationale: No user-facing copy or claims changed, so brand voice remains unchanged and compliant.
evidence: Diff only updates Netlify redirect rules and adds governance metadata
No HTML or content text files were modified by this patch

accessibility_and_inclusion.rationale: Directly improves access by restoring a functioning canonical app URL.

security_and_reliability.rationale: Simplifies redirect graph and removes a loop condition.

ship_decision.conditions: Deploy and verify /hub/beta/ returns HTTP 200 with Autopilot Lite index.html.
